title: Golden Gate National Recreation Area: People
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People               People        Major Dana Crissy (far right) and his fellow pilots on the Presidio Air Field, circa 1920s GGNRA, NPS       Learn about the individuals and groups of people who have shaped the history  of the Golden Gate National Recreation Area.            Adolph Sutro  Learn how this entrepreneur helped shape the landscape of 19th century San Francisco.          John Muir Learn about one of the country's most influential conservationist and how he helped create the National Park Service.           Major Dana Crissy Learn about the daring pilot for whom Crissy Field is named.          Ohlones and Coast Miwoks Learn about the American Indians who lived in this area.         Portuguese Dairy Farmers Learn more about the hard-working dairy farmers who shaped the agricultural landscape of the Marin Headlands.          Phillip Burton Learn about the charismatic Congressman who helped create the Golden Gate National Recreation Area.
